abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the HIV/AIDS Prevention
            and Control Project for St. Vincent and the Grenadines is to
            assist the Borrower/Recipient in controlling the spread of
            the HIV/AIDS epidemic through: a) the scaling up of programs
            for the prevention of HIV/AIDS, targeting in particular both
            HIV/AIDS high-risk groups and the general population; and b)
            the scaling up of programs for the treatment and care of
            people living with HIV/AIDS. The restructuring consists of
            amending the loan agreement, the development credit
            agreement, and the development grant agreement to: (i)
            permit the financing of works under the project, some of
            which were not originally contemplated in the Project
            Appraisal Document (PAD), which consist of: (1) the
            construction of an orphanage under component one (civil
            society organization initiatives), (2) the renovation of an
            HIV/AIDS resource center at Ministry of Education under
            component two (scaling up HIV/AIDS response by line
            Ministries), (3) the upgrading of health facilities under
            component three (strengthening the health sector responses
            to HIV/AIDS), and (4) the renovation of the National AIDS
            Secretariat (NAS) building under component four
            (strengthening the institutional capacity for program
            management); and (ii) reallocate loan, credit and grant
            funds among disbursement categories of eligible expenditures
            to address the increase of project costs and future needs of
            the project.
